DOC.brief_summary: This control , three-arm , randomize ( 1:1:1 ) , multi-site trial evaluate efficacy , feasibility acceptability cognitive-behavioral therapy ( CBT ) -based online guide unguided self-help intervention reduce Generalized Anxiety Disorder ( GAD ) Indian university student . The investigator aim assess novel electronic health ( eHealth ) intervention integrate Indian university system increase access efficacious , less stigmatized , cost-effective mental healthcare .
DOC.brief_title: Online , Guided Interventions Reduce Generalized Anxiety Disorder Among Indian University Students
DOC.detailed_description: Students three Indian college invite complete online , self-report survey . Based answer , categorized clinical , subclinical , asymptomatic Generalized Anxiety Disorder ( GAD ) . Those meet diagnostic criterion GAD detail Diagnostic Statistical Manual Mental Disorders ( DSM ) , 4th Edition classify clinical . Those score 5.7 use dimensional score GAD-Q-IV `` clinical '' classified subclinical . All others asymptomatic . After rule clinical PTSD diagnosis ( score 38 PCL5 ) currently receive mental healthcare treatment , clinical subclinical offer opportunity use one online program . Those accept randomize guided self-help program , self-help program , waitlist control group . Each student enroll reassess post-intervention ( 3 month ) followup ( 6 month later , 9 month complete baseline ) . Additionally , classify asymptomatic invited complete additional followup survey 3 9 month provide data anxiety symptom change time .
DOC.criteria: Current student one 3 college site Subjects must clinical subclinical diagnosis Generalized Anxiety Disorder ( GAD ) ; clinical diagnosis meet selfreporting DSMIV criterion GAD ; subclinical diagnosis meet score 5.7 use diagnostic score GADQIV Unable give inform consent . Is currently receive mental health treatment . Has clinical PTSD ( score 38 PCL5 )
